title: ChiBitCTy
author: ChiBitCTy
created_time: October 07, 2022, 10:24:33 PMLast edit: November 04, 2022, 01:05:58 AM by ChiBitCTy
content: VOTING IS NOW LIVE- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5419254.0Contest # 2 Voting- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5419367.0Welcome to the first annual Bitcointalk bitcoin pumpkin carving contest! (courtesy of xSlyy)Based on the feedback I received here, it seems we've got enough interest to make this fun! ( https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5415632.0 )Rules - The only rule is that your creation has to include some sort of pumpkin, gourd, squash or something of that ilk.  If you want to incorporate 3D printed stuff, NFT's, coins, whatever, all the better!  There will only be one entry per person (but this can include a bulk of items together (i.e. a 3 pumpkin set with a drawing next to it, for example). All entries must be accompanied by proof of work, which means you must include something like your username and the date on a piece of paper next to your entry. No AI programs for contest #2Have fun with this! I know if you have kids this is something I'm sure they'd enjoy doing with you, as well as getting to eat the salted & baked pumpkin seeds at the end (yum!).  Please also share this with others outside of the collectibles board.  Everyone is welcome to compete!Contest Start Date: Right NowContest End Date: Halloween Day, October 31st How will the winner be picked?: There will be a poll ran from Oct 31st to Nov 3rd.  I'm not 100% sure how I will run it, but will try and get some feedback from the community on how to most fairly do so.  Please chime in if you have any ideas! Prizes: 1st place receives everything shown below (plus more items to come, this is all I could get to easily today).  If there are enough entrants, I will include a 2nd place and maybe even a 3rd place prize as well.  Satori chip funded with .001BTCWhich Wich Coins contain actual BTC value which can be used to purchase food at these sandwich shops. It’s value and information can be found here - https://www.whichwich.com/cryptobox/The silver plated coins are Alpen DIY Coins (holograms will be included)The poker chips are MoparMining DIY chips (holograms will be included) There have been known security issues with these wallets. This is simply a collectible or something to be used as a test wallet of some sort. Bitcoin Post Cards -Courtesy of KryptowerkSecond Place Prize- lot of CardSmith cards(Courtesy of xSlyy)2 mBTC courtesy of https://paradice.in/ —Contest #2 —Due to many people not living somewhere where pumpkins are available, I’ve decided to create a second contest where the rules are to simply to create something Halloween/pumpkin bitcoin themed. This can be a 3D printed piece, a painting, digit art, NFT, painted pumpkin etc. Be creative! BUT, no AI generated stuff. You can submit such photos, but you will not be eligible for prizes. Prizes: * Lealana donated a .01 Buyer Funded coin/wallet (as seen below) for this contest.           *  .001 bitcoin to a wallet of your choosing. Picked up my pumpkins today

comments.author: KrispyKrypto
comments.body: This is a great idea. Thanks for organizing this ! Im going to go get my pumpkins tomorrow .

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: For the winner - I will toss in the other two chips to make it a full 7 chip set.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Wow.. thanks to the organizers and OGs for putting this great event together. Look at these prizes! If your looking for some inspiration try googling bitcoin pumpkin carving. Ill be including the kids in this project. Cant wait to share the results. EPIC HALLOWEEN FUN

comments.author: Oasisman
comments.body: Nice! Finally we have an official thread. I hope this will be spread out to everyone in the forum. The more, the merrier right? If my carving skill sucks, I believe I can try some digital drawing. @ChiBitCty, is that a valid entry though?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 07, 2022, 10:25:06 PMPicked up my pumpkins today  Damn those are nice looking pumpkins and ideal for carving (from my limited experience with pumpkin carving, shape&look matters a lot). For some reason those type of pumpkins are kinda hard to find in my country as we don't really have tradition of pumpkin carving, but I'll do my best and if I find a couple of suitable ones, I will certainly join. Quote from: Oasisman on October 08, 2022, 04:32:54 AMIf my carving skill sucks, I believe I can try some digital drawing. Imho, since this is bitcoin pumpkin carving contest only submissions with an actual carved pumpkin should count (OP mentioned that you could add drawing to that) otherwise this contest will be drowned in drawings, gifs, animations etc. But lets see what OP has to say about it.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I don't plan to join the contest, but it'd be exciting to see how other participant carve their pumpkin.Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 07, 2022, 10:24:33 PMPrizes: 1st place receives everything shown below (plus more items to come, this is all I could get to easily today).--snip--It'd be appreciated to mention security risks of using this hardware wallet. Personally i'd either use it as decoration or dissemble/terardown it for short review.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 07, 2022, 10:24:33 PMHow will the winner be picked?: There will be a poll ran from Oct 31st to Nov 3rd.  I'm not 100% sure how I will run it, but will try and get some feedback from the community on how to most fairly do so.  Please chime in if you have any ideas! IMO, the only way to have somewhat fair results [without exposing our "true" identities] is through limiting the ones who can vote to certain groups of users [e.g. with the help of "BPIP", you can go with the top 100 in most active, trusted or recognized].I might also join

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: Oasisman on October 08, 2022, 04:32:54 AMNice! Finally we have an official thread. I hope this will be spread out to everyone in the forum. The more, the merrier right? If my carving skill sucks, I believe I can try some digital drawing. @ChiBitCty, is that a valid entry though? Anyone who wants to be eligible to win the prizes must include an actual pumpkin/gourd. Trust me, mine will be terrible, so don’t worry, have fun with it! Quote from: ETFbitcoin on October 08, 2022, 08:34:07 AMI don't plan to join the contest, but it'd be exciting to see how other participant carve their pumpkin.Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 07, 2022, 10:24:33 PMPrizes: 1st place receives everything shown below (plus more items to come, this is all I could get to easily today).--snip--It'd be appreciated to mention security risks of using this hardware wallet. Personally i'd either use it as decoration or dissemble/terardown it for short review.I was going to let the winner know,  obviously I wrote the thread about it - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5414795.msg61002881#msg61002881. Many of us collectors collect everything from legit stuff to scams to wallets w/security risks. I would have never given this to the winner without letting them know about this (ie sending them my thread). Quote from: SFR10 on October 08, 2022, 09:42:49 AMQuote from: ChiBitCTy on October 07, 2022, 10:24:33 PMHow will the winner be picked?: There will be a poll ran from Oct 31st to Nov 3rd.  I'm not 100% sure how I will run it, but will try and get some feedback from the community on how to most fairly do so.  Please chime in if you have any ideas! IMO, the only way to have somewhat fair results [without exposing our "true" identities] is through limiting the ones who can vote to certain groups of users [e.g. with the help of "BPIP", you can go with the top 100 in most active, trusted or recognized].I might also join Hmmm. This is an interesting idea and thanks for sharing it, trying to figure out what’s best voting wise. Does that most recognized list update still to this day ? Btw, you should definitely join! Anyone else have any suggestions for how to set up the vote ?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 08, 2022, 05:26:55 PMDoes that most recognized list update still to this day ?Yeah those BPIP lists are updated constantly.Quote from: ChiBitCTy on October 08, 2022, 05:26:55 PMAnyone else have any suggestions for how to set up the vote ? As @SFR10 said, you have to limit the voters in some way because if you go with a simple poll, someone will try to abuse it with bunch of brand new accounts. If there is any chance that something can be abused around here, it will be. My suggestion is to make people vote by simply writing the name of the contestant they think it was the best, limit it to at least Full Member & above and eventually certain amount of merit earned.

comments.author: LFC_Bitcoin
comments.body: Seems like a great idea OP. Just a word of warning, I am terrible at art but I will give this a go this week. I’ll go & get some pumpkins maybe Tuesday & submit my entry before the end of the week. In the unlikely event I win a prize, I will donate it to a charity of the OP’s choice or somebody struggling with the cost of living increases etc.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Just wanted to mention that we now have a second place prize established.  Thanks to xSlyy for donating a lot of Cardsmith cards (a very popular crypto collector card company). Thanks to https://paradice.in/ for donating 2mBTC for the second prize winner. More prizes will certainly be coming! As well as a 3rd place prize if we get enough participation.
